overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-26, Sendo-labs/frontend had 8 new PRs (9 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: refactor:  Project structure and update configurations. Moved from react to Nextjs
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body:
This pull request migrates the project from a Vite+React app to a Next.js 15 application with Bun as the package manager, introduces Biome for linting and formatting, and updates the overall project structure and configuration files. It also removes legacy files and dependencies related to the previous stack. The changes modernize the codebase, improve developer experience, and set up new conventions for code quality and workflow.
From React / TailwindV3 / Javascript to Nextjs / TailwindV4 / Typescript.

**Migration to Next.js and Bun:**

* Migrated from Vite+React to Next.js 15, updating `package.json` scripts, dependencies, and project name to `sendo`, and switched to Bun as the package manager. Legacy dependencies and scripts were removed.
* Added `next.config.ts` for Next.js configuration and updated the project entry points accordingly.
* Updated `README.md` to Next.js boilerplate and added `CLAUDE.md` for project guidance, architecture, and workflow documentation. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L1-R36) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6ebdb617a8104a7756d0cf36578ab01103dc9f07e4dc6feb751296b9c402faf7R1-R173)

**Linting, Formatting, and Code Quality:**

* Introduced Biome for linting and formatting with a comprehensive `biome.json` configuration, replacing ESLint and Prettier. ESLint config and related dependencies were removed. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2bc8a1f5e9380d5a187a4e90f11b4dd36c3abad6aea44c84be354a4f44cdec55R1-R70) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a32a0887ed9d1d707bbb3b845b7df7fd40e673c47e7b60a3ebd896b68d3b8839L1-L38)
* Added a Husky pre-commit hook to automatically format code using Biome before each commit.

**Project Structure and Configuration:**

* Updated `components.json` for shadcn/ui registry, enabling RSC and TSX support, and set up Tailwind CSS 4 integration.
* Migrated postcss configuration to `postcss.config.mjs` for Tailwind CSS 4 compatibility.
* Removed legacy configuration files: `jsconfig.json`, `postcss.config.js`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7fe0ab2d61296b5df4add971654584ba7ee8082cc5b79ffa3b60da0ed9f0b3ebL1-L10) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-05ed1c7f99e45b485708115502a1e0f28c8547e9a9a29c1b8664f79103cf7873L1-L6)

**Removal of Legacy and Unused Files:**

* Deleted legacy Vite/React files and Base44 SDK integrations: `index.html`, `src/App.jsx`, `src/api/base44Client.js`, `src/api/entities.js`, `src/api/functions.js`, `src/api/integrations.js`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-0eb547304658805aad788d320f10bf1f292797b5e6d745a3bf617584da017051L1-L13) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-d274a54187c91ba0f532df2a9e194e27ab50e988f5e4c33f5a7893918320c661L1-L14) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-4b22c2630841e851e970815e1fb90a121b7165c7e36fc6420f68304f6f33b16fL1-L8) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-cd055a0eba7b6c82d81e037992e9f2676bc3013ec97bd37ca68a721b92616b76L1-L7) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-049ece780362020de9333f238c2de10cbf2457449ea61f36a02d75126cea9b98L1-L9) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-1e1b94e4a7cb3d5571cef08910343d507084b36191f99c957514278cbe6f8545L1-L26)

**Documentation and Guidance:**

* Added detailed project guidance and architecture overview in `CLAUDE.md`, including development commands, environment variables, and technology stack.
* Updated `README.md` to reflect Next.js usage and deployment instructions.

topPRs.title: feat: improve pages structure in order to anticipate a better data recovery strategy
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body: Refactor pages structure to fit with Nextjs best practice. For the moment, we just display mocked data, but in the next PRs, we are going to use real fetched user data from the agent. With Nextjs, the data fetching must be done on serverside and passed as props to client components (+ security and + fast)

topPRs.title: feat: new pages
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body:
This pull request refactors several main pages (`analyzer`, `leaderboard`, `worker`, and the new `onboarding` page) to use a shared layout component, `PageWrapper`, for consistent styling and structure. It also introduces a new onboarding flow and makes minor improvements to the contact section. These changes improve code maintainability, visual consistency, and user onboarding experience.

**Shared Layout Refactor:**

* Replaced custom layout wrappers in `src/app/analyzer/client.tsx`, `src/app/leaderboard/client.tsx`, and `src/app/worker/client.tsx` with the shared `PageWrapper` component, ensuring consistent page structure and reducing duplicated code. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-5eada83b5857ea3eb390602cfbb8443939c66c9d28f234197efbc52b20d49d62R20) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-5eada83b5857ea3eb390602cfbb8443939c66c9d28f234197efbc52b20d49d62L249-R250) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-5eada83b5857ea3eb390602cfbb8443939c66c9d28f234197efbc52b20d49d62L342-R342) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-864779a54a15fad503964336872e4073b35db1c668f43f327e7fdca7b2391c62R9) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-864779a54a15fad503964336872e4073b35db1c668f43f327e7fdca7b2391c62L180-R181) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-864779a54a15fad503964336872e4073b35db1c668f43f327e7fdca7b2391c62L358-R358) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-20ed7f89df08f1bc63addf331680bcbecded8386364bc8ec824aecdf1cc49c34R21) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-20ed7f89df08f1bc63addf331680bcbecded8386364bc8ec824aecdf1cc49c34L171-R172) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-20ed7f89df08f1bc63addf331680bcbecded8386364bc8ec824aecdf1cc49c34L277) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-20ed7f89df08f1bc63addf331680bcbecded8386364bc8ec824aecdf1cc49c34L290-R289)

**Onboarding Flow Addition:**

* Added a new onboarding page (`src/app/onboarding/client.tsx` and `src/app/onboarding/page.tsx`) with a step-by-step guide, rewards system explanation, and calls-to-action for new contributors. This page uses `PageWrapper` for layout consistency. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2f2cf00dbe4930b1bbc02139a05dce3b2f4ce7c4955d775f375c26f7d2a5eb89R1-R396) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-5ff8336f9c23d713d14e7d213695092f92f81381421e6d128e24857d5f8b0f3aR1-R22)

**Contact Section UI Update:**

* Updated the `ContactSection` component to adjust section height, padding, and heading sizes for improved visual balance and responsiveness. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b6d289b33b9a10f149dbf2d4bd001c64c559cb4e3e16ae3b33df67879d264373L1-R1) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b6d289b33b9a10f149dbf2d4bd001c64c559cb4e3e16ae3b33df67879d264373L26-R32)

topPRs.title: refactor: worker-plugin
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body:
- Updated label elements in the RuleBuilder component to enhance readability by breaking long lines into multiple lines.
- Ensured consistent formatting for label attributes across different rule types, improving overall code clarity.

topContributors.summary: standujar: Made a foundational contribution by delivering the initial implementation of the Sendo Worker in `Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker#1`, a significant effort involving over 13,000 lines of code. They also enhanced the `Sendo-labs/leaderboard` repository by adding new projects and JSON endpoints via PRs #3 and #4. Their activity shows a primary focus on feature work, bug fixes, and establishing test infrastructure.

Neysixx: Focused on significant refactoring and feature development in the Sendo-labs/frontend repository, landing several impactful changes. They executed a large-scale improvement to the page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3), refactored the worker-plugin (Sendo-labs/frontend#6), and resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This work demonstrates a primary focus on refactoring, which accounted for the majority of their code changes.

xdrkush: This week, xdrkush focused on resolving an issue within the `sendo-api` repository, merging PR #3 to address a bug in the buy/sell account functionality. This was a notable contribution with over 700 lines of changes across 17 files. Their work was evenly split between bug fixes and feature development, including updates to both application code and tests.

MonteCrypto999: Focused on a significant feature addition for the Jupiter plugin, opening a pull request to add referral fee support (Sendo-labs/plugin-jupiter#1). This large-scale effort introduced over 5,900 lines of code across 31 files. The work primarily involved feature implementation, configuration changes, and the addition of new tests.

M4XGO: Focused on improving project infrastructure by establishing automated release management and NPM publishing workflows in the Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore repository (PR #2). This work consisted entirely of modifications to configuration files, indicating a primary focus on tooling and deployment processes.

tionebDotsamapha: This week's focus was on improving project documentation, merging a pull request in Sendo-labs/sendo-api (#2) to update the README file. Their contributions were entirely focused on documentation.
